reviews.text: We lodged at the Grosser Kurfurst for almost a week. As a family of four we occupied two rooms, both very spacious and nice. The bathroom was also quite good, and contained a bidet, which is quite rare and useful to speed up cleaning operations in the morning.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel in a convenient area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very conveniently located, as the Markishes Museum stop of the U2 line is within 20-30 meters, and the Museum Island is within walking distance (approximately 20 minutes from the hotel). The area is very calm, and nice to walk by. An Edeka supermarket is also quite near, as well as various restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: The personnell and staff is very kind, and helpful for any need. Hotel's standards are quite high, and both common areas and rooms are very clean.
reviews.title: Great location for exploring Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a very nice discovery, and certainly a place to come back.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is all about location. It's great for exploring the entire city. The hotel itself is nice. The staff are friendly. However, the housekeeping isn't that great. For us, it was a good choice as the location was excellent. The metro station is couple of feet away but if you like walking, you can cover most of the sites on foot.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location

reviews.text: First time to Berlin, and this hotel, therefore I cannot compare it to any other hotels in Berlin. I found the location very convient and there is a underground stop right outside the hotel. Did not eat in the hotel, therefore cannot comment about the food but the staff, well all very friendly, and there is a great hotel bar, which one can get very comfortable in.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay at the Derag

reviews.text: The Staff was very kind and very polite,
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.disliked: — I think internet service must be free

reviews.text: The room was clean and perfect.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: We really enjoy thet jurney in that hotel andi'll come back again!!!
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel in Friendly City

reviews.text: Very Good Position.. just few second from the metro
reviews.title: Well worth its price and more!
Too much "OK", but no "WOW"
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel room - so maybe I'd have felt different if I'd stayed in one of the apartments that are also offered. First, the good things: it's just steps from the U-bahn metro. It's immaculately clean. Bathroom has a large tub. Staff were friendly enough. The room is large. well decorated and beds are comfortable. I think we had one of the better rooms, overlooking a little green scrap of park and facing south. The worse points wouldnt have mattered if it had been a cheaper place, but for the money it's just that I have had better value elsewhere. (There was too much "OK" and no "WOW!" in other words.) The buffet breakfast was OK - the scrambled eggs were burned yet were still put out for the guests to eat. Not a great selection of cereals, breads, etc. not bad, but just ....average. The bedside lights weren't comfortable to read by, although there was plenty of lighting. The district, though not far from the centre, was sort of suburbanl, not many places to eat locally if you didn't want Indian or the hotel restaurant (after the burned eggs, I was wary of the latter) and there was no vibe to the district at all. There was an electricity saving system in the hotel which is theoretically good - but it meant you had to remember to put your key in a slot as soon as you entered your room, so the electricity would keep working. I kept timing it wrong, putting the key in before the room door was shut, or forgetting and then being in the bathroom when the electricity suddeny went off, etc.! Towels were barely adequate, small and thin. Toiletries OK, nothing luxurious. I just didn't feel it was a hotel I wanted to return to, but if you're already booked there, don't cancel ....I think you'll find it is okay even if does not thrill you. .
Markish Museum Metro (U2) Entrance just at the door of the hotel. From that you can move easily to PostdamerPlatz, AlexanderPlatz, etc.
reviews.title: Near Metro. Large Room. Very Good !

reviews.text: Large room, including a sofa, a desk, a small kitchen with microwave and frigobar.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.text: The only inconvinient was that we got a lower rate but with room service only twice a week, we stayed 5 days and they excahnge our towels twice and bed once. It was not a big problem and if you want you can order cleaning for 6 euros.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel and good location

reviews.text: Excellent Service. Would stay again, specialy for the LARGE room what is unusual in Europe.
reviews.title: Above average with but disappointing because of its potential

likes.liked: — Reasonable price, Big clean room with a FULL kitchen, Attentative staff, right next to U-bahn.
likes.disliked: — expensive wifi, small room safe, parking far away, poor climate/ventilation system

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel and were excited to hear from the taxi driver that it was a "very good hotel".
reviews.title: Modern, Friendly, Recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is very impressive and the whole look of the hotel from the common areas to the rooms is very modern, clean cut and stylish. The staff were super helpful, friendly and couldnt do more for us, very impressed with the customer service.
reviews.title: Great service, awesome location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and well furnished but considering how modern the common areas were, the rooms and bathroom were comfortable, functional and just fine but not as "modern" as the rest of the hotel. We had a nice canal view though and its located in a quiet area. The inclusive breakfast buffet was simple but hearty and fresh with eggs, rolls, cold meats and cheese, fruit, cereals and croissants etc.
reviews.title: Just Plain Perfect!!!

likes.disliked: — Stupid so called 'Double' beds that were just 2 singles pushed together

reviews.title: Nice location, friendly hotel
reviews.text: It is in the business district but if you dont wish to use the next door S-Bahn underground, you can walk very easily to Unter Den Linden (10 - 15 mins walk) and the Nikolaiviertel (about 5 mins walk) where there were lovely traditional German houses/pubs/restaurants/shops selling lovely food. A real gem. The TV Tower (Fernsehen Turm) was also just 10 mins walk and was very busy around that area.
Once on Unter den Linden the number 100 or 200 bus can take you very cheaply all around the main sights of Berlin, which I would recommend.
reviews.title: Facility fine, but no control over room temp

reviews.text: The Grosser Kurfürst hotel is a nice hotel, well located. I stayed at quite a few Berlinhotels over the past years. Many have a good quality, this one as well, although it also has a cetrain dullness.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Nice staff. Modern 4 star hotel. Got the best price within the centre of Berlin. Free water and beer! They even gave us a free fan when we complained it was very hot (no air conditioner). Only negative point was the large stain on the carpet and the very run down sink with moss (we didn't complain in fairness). Otherwise everything else in the bathroom and room was spotless. Would recommend and visit again.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very good hotel, clean and neat rooms, beds were comfortable. There was a subway station just metres out the front door. hotel is located just out of the main town area so a litle bit quieter and is a close walk to the shopping centre. Concierge spoke english and were helpful. This hotel also had two complementary beers in your mini bar each day which I found good. Would definitely stay here again and was pretty good value for your dollar
reviews.title: Excellent Location to Trains!

reviews.text: Very modern hotel, light and airy, lovely room with beautiful bathroom, shower had strong water pressure! The only negative comment I have about the room, is that there is ducted airconditioning, however the temperature cannot be adjusted, which made sleeping with an open window very noisy. Within "spitting distance" from the Metro, so convenient. Reception staff super friendly, helped us with city map and advice on best restaurants, all situated at the Nikolai Viertel within easy walking distance. The Alexander Platz was a 10 minute walk away, therefore this hotel was at the best location for our requirements. I would definitely highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Highly recommended in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is extremely dated and it truly looks like nothing has been done with the decor since the 1980's. The rooms AC and wireless Internet was so bad it was almost none existent. If we had paid more then $80 for the room (hotwire), we would of been really upset. I just wish that they would reevaluate the status of it being a 4 star. It maybe a 3 star thanks to its location but that's it.
reviews.title: I have no idea how they got 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You couldn't beat this hotel for location, literally 10 seconds walk to the Markisches Museum underground line (U2 red)...and that's if you were dawdling!
reviews.title: perfect location

likes.liked: — Location. Fresh baked rolls at the door every morning. Value for money
likes.disliked: — Stairs at the entrance - not very suitcase friendly!

reviews.text: We stayed in an double apartment room which was huge! We were expecting a little kitchenette in the corner of the room, but what we got was literally a suite with a large sitting room and kitchen complete with microwave and dish washer. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast - we stocked up with milk, cheeses and meats at the supermarket down the road and then ordered from reception freshly baked rolls and croissants to be delivered to our door. Who could ask for more!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — The friendlyness of the staff, they were very helpful.

reviews.title: Excellent base for a break in Berlin
reviews.text: Admittedly the maid only cleans the room and changes the towels every other day, but we never put our towels out to be refreshed every day even when we have the option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were extremely friendly, spoke brilliant English, and it was spotlessly clean! We ate in the restaurant two nights and had complimentary drinks and extra starter both times, and the food was gorgeous!
reviews.title: great city great hotel

reviews.text: A previous review had said that the hotel was a little out of the way for nightlife...this is true, but when you've been out sightseeing all day we certainly didn't have the energy. The lovely restored area of Nikolaiviertel with lots of great traditional bars and restaurants is only a 10 minute walk away, and if you haven't got the energy to walk that far and fancy something other than pork knuckle, the Indian across the road is superb too! I recommend the Punjabi/Maharaja Thalis...both fantastic value for money!
reviews.title: Loved Berlin, loved Grosser...
Nice 1997 hotel south of Museuminsel
reviews.text: Clean carpeyed room facing away from the Spree. Open window some streetnoise. A 4 as the room temperature couldn't be adjusted. Bottled water and beer were nice after trecking around Berlin. Didn't eat Breakfast there at €16 or use the Sauna/ training studio. Ate brunch at Millie's home cooking next to Edeka 150m north over the canal. A five for friendly staff. Recommended!

It was first time in germany and berlin 2 years ago.Our group was about 15 people and booked this hotel and i would say amazing.Service level was very high and everything was done very professional.Breakfast,other foods,bar,frontdesk staff,cleaning(everything perfect).Location very good and grab taxi only wave your hands.I can say that this hotel service is so good that you cannot compare it for 80% of 4star hotels around the world.Thanks for the staff and hopefully i can soon come back again.
reviews.title: i would have given 4,5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was a first ever visit to Berlin the key selling point of the hotel had been its proximity to the public transport system to allow easy access for getting out and about. The U Bahn station is literary on the doorstep of the front door with Alexanderplatz just two stops away or a 10 minute walk if you feel like stetching your legs.
reviews.title: A lovely touch that made the stay all the more special

reviews.text: The room was spacious and comfortable, even during three days when the temperature in the city went into the lows 30s and turned the old versions of the train carriages into saunas. The two beers and two waters freely put in the fridge each day were especially welcome when you stepped back into the coolness of the room after a few hours walking around the baking hot streets!!
reviews.title: A very reasonable choice

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location: it's very close to the metro station (Märkisches Museum stop), to a Supermarket (Alnatura) and to some other bakery and grocery shops. Moreover, it has a very good price considering its quality. Our room was wide and well furnished, we also had tea/coffee facilities and two free water and beer per day included into the price.
reviews.title: Good location, close to the metro and to various services

reviews.text: The only negative aspect was the lack of air conditioning or fans into the rooms, we would have liked it since we stayed there in some very hot days and our room was pretty hot at night.
reviews.title: Air conditioning!

reviews.text: I know the summer in Europe this year has been exceptionally hot, but don't pretend a 'fresh air circulation system' is adequate. We were fortunate to have a room facing the canal so we could leave the large windows open at night without being kept awake by street noise. Even with the window open it was too hot to sleep well. I heard other guests asking for fans at Reception, but they were told all had been given out. Our room had blinds that were meant to automatically lower when the sun shone directly into the room and also in case of extreme wind or rain. There was no way for us to control these blinds and they never lowered. If we could have lowered these blinds in the morning, before the day got hotter, we could have kept to room a lot cooler. This was especially annoying as my daughter was ill and stayed in the room for 3 days, unable to rest properly because of the heat and the light that shone through the curtains.
reviews.title: Gracious intro to Berlin

reviews.text: It's a pity the rooms were so hot as otherwise it was a very good hotel. It is within walking distance of many sights and museums and the hotel restaurant (Lebanese) is reasonable value with nice tasting food. The staff are pleasant and best of all, for someone on a long journey, it has washing machines and dryers the guests can use at a very reasonable 4 Euros per load. Just make sure you memorise some of the German words for washing cycles before you go down to the basement to use them.
reviews.title: NO AIR CON IN A 4 STAR HOTEL??!!??!!??

reviews.text: Really well-located, with spotless comfortable rooms. The staff is very pleasant, and even the breakfast was first-class. A little pricey but worthwhile especially if Berlin is your first stop in Europe or you are staying a short time.
reviews.title: Lost its sparkle...
